displaytitle: Armed Woman Seated in Contemplation (Bellona?), Attended by Two Putti
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
markings: Watermark: six-pointed star with circle as center, both elements in circle, all surmounted by cross
inscribed: lower left: canceled inscription (PE?) in pen and brown ink; verso: P. da Rossi, twice iH two different hands in brown ink

titles.title: Armed Woman Seated in Contemplation (Bellona?), Attended by Two Putti

texts.textentryhtml: Dan Fellows Platt (Lugt supp. 750a and 2066b) lower left verso, reported in note on verso as ex McCartney collection and Goldstein sale (New York, American Art Association, 2-5 March 1920), no. 406, attributed to Charles Le Brun or P. da Rossi

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: p. 244, no. 807 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)

caption: Unknown Italian artist, Armed Woman Seated in Contemplation (Bellona?), Attended by Two Putti, mid–17th century. Red chalk; 25.9 x 18.6 cm. Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-821)
